content: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life.
Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius (212 degrees Fahrenheit) at sea level.
There are 24 hours in a day, divided into AM (ante meridiem) and PM (post meridiem).
The average adult human body contains about 60% water.
The four basic tastes are sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. A fifth taste, umami, is also recognized.
A year on Earth is approximately 365.25 days, which is why we have leap years.
The primary colors of light are red, green, and blue. The primary colors of pigment are cyan, magenta, yellow, and black.
The distance between the Earth and the Sun is approximately 93 million miles (150 million kilometers).
Sound travels at approximately 343 meters per second (1,125 feet per second) in air at room temperature.
